pageContext.claim: “Sometimes I jokingly say or sarcastically say: If we didn't do tests, we'd look great. But you know what? It's not the right thing to do.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump at a rally in Oklahoma said he asked "my people, ‘Slow the testing down please.'" Then his aides, including White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany, said the remark was "made in jest." Asked whether it was a joke, Trump said, "I don't kid." But then he conceded that it was, in fact, a joke during a subsequent interview on Fox News. Some would call this a confusing way to communicate with the public about a pandemic.
